solution.text:
First we draw the figure as per the data given in the problem
If two tangents to a circle are parallel then the distance between the two will be equal to the diameter of the circle
It is given that the tangent AB is perpendicular to PQ and cuts XY and PQ at M and N
therefore, MN=distance between XY and PQ
\(MN=2r=_{{2*j*k}}_\)

content.text:
Tangents(XY and PQ) to a circle of radius=_{{j*k}}_ are parallel to each other
another tangent AB with point of contact C is perpendicular to PQ.
If AB intersects XY at M and PQ at N, find the length of the line segment MN
